    • Method Detail

      • encryptionDecryption

        public static void encryptionDecryption(java.lang.String key,
                                        int cipherMode,
                                        java.io.File input,
                                        java.io.File output)
                                 throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                        java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to perform the encryption and decryption operations using the DES algorithm.
        Parameters:
        key - This is the
        cipherMode - This parameter is to show the mode, so that we can show that this method will know if it should encrypt or decrypt data.
        input - This parameter contains the file that we want to decrypt or encrypt.
        output - This parameter will be the output file so this will have the contents of encrypted or decrypted file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This exception will be used on the Input error.
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - This exception will constructs an InvalidKeyException with no detail message. A detail message is a String that describes this particular exception.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - This exception is thrown when a particular cryptographic algorithm is requested but is not available in the environment.
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - This is the exception for invalid key specifications.
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - This exception is thrown when a particular padding mechanism is requested but is not available in the environment.
        See Also:
        Exception
